intro: Dasistoma pubescens, commonly known as the hairy dasistoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Dasistoma pubescens is often found in moist, wooded areas and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
